title: Build from the Back
description: Learn how to move the ball safely from defense into attack!

questions.question: What’s the easiest way to move the ball up the field?
options: Through the middle where it’s crowded
Along the sidelines where fewer players are
questions.explanation: The sidelines usually have more space, so it’s easier to pass and dribble there.

questions.question: Why should defenders spread out when starting an attack?
options: To give themselves space to receive a pass
To stand next to each other
questions.explanation: Spreading creates passing lanes and makes it easier to keep the ball.

questions.question: Who should step forward to receive the ball from the goalie?
questions.explanation: The nearest defender helps the goalie by offering an easy option to pass.

questions.question: What’s a smart choice if the middle is too tight?
options: Switch play to the opposite sideline
questions.explanation: Switching to the other side finds more open space.

questions.question: When a teammate is open on the wing, you should:
options: Pass the ball quickly to them
questions.explanation: A quick pass to an open wing player moves the attack forward safely.

questions.question: Why do we sometimes take a few small passes instead of one long pass?
options: To keep better control and accuracy
questions.explanation: Short, accurate passes help keep possession under pressure.

questions.question: What does ‘playing out of the back’ mean?
options: Building an attack from our defenders and goalie
Clearing the ball as far as possible
questions.explanation: It’s moving the ball forward with control, starting from defense.

questions.question: If a defender is double-teamed, you should:
options: Offer yourself for a pass in space
questions.explanation: Moving into space gives your teammate a safe outlet.

questions.question: When building from the back, why is it okay to pass backwards sometimes?
options: It keeps the ball when forward options are blocked
questions.explanation: A backward pass can reset and open up new spaces to attack.

questions.question: In which situation should you play a long ball forward?
options: When the other team is pressing high
When they’re far from our goal
questions.explanation: A long ball can break a high press by finding teammates behind defenders.

questions.question: What role does the defensive midfielder play in building from the back?
options: Offers a passing option in front of defense
questions.explanation: They link defense and attack by receiving and distributing passes.

questions.question: If a pass in front is risky, you should:
questions.explanation: Passing wide lets you keep control and find a better angle.

questions.question: Why is checking over your shoulder useful when building out?
options: To see where teammates and defenders are
questions.explanation: It helps you pick the best passing lane and avoid pressure.

questions.question: What does it mean to ‘break the lines’ in build-up play?
options: Pass into space behind the opponent’s midfield
questions.explanation: It moves the ball past defenders into areas where teammates can run.

questions.question: The most important thing in building from the back is:
options: Keeping possession and moving safely forward
questions.explanation: Safe, smart passing helps your team control the game and create chances.
